summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on September 16, 2013. It designates executors for his estate, outlines the payment of debts and taxes, and bequeaths all his property to the trustees of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust. It includes detailed powers granted to the executors and provisions to disinherit any beneficiary who contests the will.

locations: Little St. James Island, St. Thomas, United States Virgin Islands
Territory of the United States Virgin Islands, Division of St. Thomas and St. John
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's entire estate, after debts and taxes, is bequeathed to the trustees of 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2013 Trust'.
The primary executors named are Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and James E. Staley, with David Mitchell as successor.
Each executor is to receive a fixed compensation of $250,000 upon completion of probate.
The will includes a 'no-contest' clause, disinheriting any beneficiary who challenges the will or the trust.
The executors are granted extremely broad powers to manage, invest, sell, and litigate on behalf of the estate without needing court approval.
